actions.message:
1-5 = Fails
6-9 = Successes (unless otherwise stated by GM)
10 = Criticals

10 + 10 = Critical Pair counts for 4 successes
10 + 10* = Messy Critical counts for 4 successes
**Critical pair containing one or more hunger die*
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
Start Willpower = Composure + Resolve. 
You *cannot* buy extra dots of Willpower either during character creation or with experience points, but you can get more through increased Composure and/or Resolve.
When rolling Willpower you unly roll with you *undamaged* levels of Willpower (ie. 2 superficial damage means two less dice)

0 Wilpower = Impaired, receiving a -2 dice penalty to Social and Mental tests. They still get to roll one die if required to roll their pool, as per the usual rules.

**Spending Willpower**
■ Re-roll up to three regular dice, (not Hunger dice) in any dice pool (with some exceptions)
■ Take control of your character for one turn during frenzy or when under the influence of super- natural coercion, such as Dominate or Presence (see p. 255).
■ Minute movements while staked
■ Ignore Health damage penalties
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Increase Attribute:**   New level x 5
**Increase Skill:**       New level x 3
**New Specialty:**        3
**Clan Discipline:**      New level x 5
**Other Discipline:**     New level x 7
**Blood Sorcery Ritual:** Ritual level x 3
**Advantage:**            3 per dot
**Blood Potency:**        New level x 10

actions.message:
**Lists/References:**
Characters = list over character information commands. Simply type in the appropriate name or title found on this list. 
Story = Overview of story/session information so far
SessionX = resumé of session and other details. Replace X with session number (fx. "Session1")
Ceilican = Ceilican Size Reference

**Rules:**
Healing = Healing system, both for Health (Physical Battle) and Willpower (Social Battle)
Rolls = Dice rolls rules explained
Willpower = short list over willpower rules/spending functions
XP = experience cost list (evt. see p137 in the book)

**Misc.:**
Drive = Gives the link to the RPG google drive

actions.message:
**Name:**         "Ironclad"
**Child:**        Steffi
**Clan:**         Brujah
**Description:**
The Ironclad is a bulky fellow who is never seen without his black leather jacket with too many badges to count, or his polarized dark Ray-Ban-style sunglasses. Yes, even in his sunless existence, her wears his damn sunglasses. His hair is dark and his short beard likewise, and he tends to like wearing a red bandanna on the top of his head.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message: Approximate visualization of the "Ironclad" (minus his heavy leather jacket though)
actions.name: Send Image

actions.message:
**Name:**         Detective Shane Well
**Status:**       Alive
**Race:**         Mortal
**Occupation:**   Police Officer (Detective)
**Workplace:**    Metropolitan Police
**Description:**
Detective Well is a serious-looking fella, who seems confident and stern and has a good deal of experience within the Police force. As a contact of the Sheriff, he has been made available to the coterie, though only as a “loan”. When he met the coterie at Hotel Savoy, he seemed nervous and wary of them, and clearly not used to be treated as “nicely” as they did. He left, however, with a realization that he might prefer being treated un-nicely, but predictable, over the coterie he doesn’t quite know where he has. His mind was wiped of the worst of it though, but he still bears an uneasy feeling with these new “investigators” that Dalton has “lent” him out to.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Name:**         Casper Drum
**Status:**       Dead
**Race:**         Mortal
**Occupation:**   Student (College Jock)
**Workplace:**    Out of City College
**Description:**
Victim number one, Casper Drum, was found four days ago, tucked away in a storm drain. Unfortunately, recent rains have made a mess of the crime scene. Casper was a strapping young lad in his early twenties, attending college in another city but home over a hiatus in his studies. He gives the impression of being a young instragram heavy using Jock and often poses with the football sweater of his team.
*Zeferet* found his number (for whatever he wants to use it for), and his parents address here in London, where he was staying. 
**Morgue investigation update:**
Slashing weapon, care has been taken to slash major arteries, and there is much less blood present in the bodies than there should be. In both cases there are significant head traumas from blunt objects as well. The attacker seems an odd mix of competent and furious. There are no fang marks anywhere on the bodies, but that doesn't rule out Kindred. However, a little more investigating revealed the victims to be incapacitated by the blow to the head, and only later slashed. There seems to be no pre-mortem damage, which clashes somewhat with the rage theory.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Name:**         Don Ellard
**Status:**       Dead
**Race:**         Mortal
**Occupation:**   Basement Cooker?
**Workplace:**    Basement?
**Description:**
Victim number two, Don Ellard, was found two days ago in a copse of trees in James' Park, splayed on a rock and emptied of blood, which is why Well immediately contacted Dalton. The site has since been cleared but little else of note was found. 
Don was a man in his mid-thirties, who still lived in his parents’ basement and had no registered place of work. Despite the popular images of such individuals he was quite a looker. 
The Detective revealed for the coterie that it seemed he was living larger than he should be able to afford, even if supported financially by his parents. Additionally, he reconised some of his buys and he might have had something to do with cooking ecstasy.
**Morgue investigation update:**
Slashing weapon, care has been taken to slash major arteries, and there is much less blood present in the bodies than there should be. In both cases there are significant head traumas from blunt objects as well. The attacker seems an odd mix of competent and furious. There are no fang marks anywhere on the bodies, but that doesn't rule out Kindred. However, a little more investigating revealed the victims to be incapacitated by the blow to the head, and only later slashed. There seems to be no pre-mortem damage, which clashes somewhat with the rage theory.
**Interrogation :** 
His family revealed he was a "succesful businessman" and highly competent in chemistry. They destroyed all his stuff on his request, should he dissappear. He had complained that someone was stalking him "AFK" to his family.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Name:**         Shelly DiSanto
**Status:**       Dead
**Race:**         Mortal
**Occupation:**   Vagrant
**Workplace:**    None
**Description:**
Well directed them to a long-abandoned apartment building , and asked that the coterie contact him with instructions when they are done at the scene. 
On the third floor there is an obvious squat, where someone has been living for quite some time. There is rudimentary scavenged furniture, bedding, and drug equipment. In one of the rooms lies the corpse of a vagrant , similarly savaged as the earlier victims, but visibly less so.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Name:**         Bradon Cortez
**Status:**       Dead
**Race:**         Mortal
**Occupation:**   Model and Sex Worker
**Workplace:**    ?
**Description:**
A fourth victim has been found, and this time, there’s no keeping the lid on. When the vampires were sleeping, a janitor stumbled upon the corpse of Braden Cortez, male model and sex worker, in a suite at a nearby hotel. This time, the coterie is told that the murder scene is more elaborate and the police are all over it. Unfortunately, Well himself hasn’t got access.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Name:**         Frank Matthews
**Child:**        Elizabeth
**Clan:**         Ventrue
**Description:**
Mr. Matthews is a little bit of an older gentleman, if you had to guess, he must have been around the late 40’s when he was turned. You aren’t sure how old he is, but he often refers to the days of the 19th century, so he must be around 200 years at least. He often wears some kind of suit in light greyish colours to match his silvering hair. Though, on occasion, he has been caught in “just” wearing a vest or a shirt and pullover combination. He acts as an English gentleman most of the time, tho he seems to have a weakness for a pretty face, and can be a little... "flirting" and thats putting it nicely.

actions.message:
**Superficial Healing**
**Health:** Depending on their Blood Potency (see bottom of sheet under "Mending"), a vampire can mend one or more points of Superficial Health damage with a single Rouse Check. Vampires can make one Rouse Check per turn to mend Superficial Health damage.

**Willpower:** Each "story" players heal Superficial Willpower damages equal to their *Composure* OR *Resolve* scores (use highest). 


**Aggravated Healing**
**Health:** takes an entire night, and upon the next sundown the Kindred makes three *Rouse checks* in addition to the one for awakening (4 checks in all), and heals **one** Aggravated health level, as well as one Crippling Injury or similar impairment. A vampire can only mend one point of Aggravated damage per night. As with awakening, if these Rouse Checks raise the vampire’s Hunger above Hunger 5, they fall into torpor rather than testing for hunger frenzy. You succeed in healing no matter the dice result, though you can risk a rapid increase of *Hunger*.

**Willpower:** At the start of the next story, a character who has acted in accordance to their Ambition can heal 1 level of Aggravated Willpower damage.

*Story being a natural "chapter" in the campaign determined by the Storyteller. Fx. by the end of an objective.

actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Yield:** 7xp
**Gametime:** 1-2 AM Spring time, Monday. 
**Session time:** 5 hours
**People Encountered:** The Seneschal – Vanessa Reed, The Prince – Nathaniel Farrell, The Sheriff – Lowell Dalton
**Recap:**
The day of the initiation of the coterie. Everyone was left to their own devices for the first part of the night. On the way to the ceremony Zeferet stumbled upon the cat emporium cafe, and unknowingly trespassed on Ceilican (Werecat) territory. He managed to barely avoid a fight. 
The coterie was formed, and properly introduced to the Camarilla, the Sheriff was assigned as Shadow (with his childer as stand-in if he was busy). They mingled a bit, and after a while Max, chose to ride with an Italian character a certain meeting. Here he met with another curious character, and asked him for something, which he complied, giving him two metal flasks. 
In the meanwhile, the Sheriff (Lowell Dalton) had approached Elizabeth about the coterie “meeting” about the assignment the coterie had been activated for. She started tracking down her coterie quickly realizing Max was missing, and that Steffi had tried going after him. Result being a combination of Cedrics premonition (Auspex) and Zeferet’s hacking skills, they tracked him down, seemingly coming out from, or at least in the area of, the forbidden area. 
They arrived back at seemingly annoyed Sheriff and a nervous Zeferet, however, the Sheriff had been talked somewhat down by a call from the Italian guy from earlier. He quickly went over their assignment; investigating a possible Masquerade breach. He gave them the aide of his personal contact from within the police; Detective Shane Well, before hastily going on to his next meeting. 
Session ended by the coterie asking about Max’s questionable actions.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Yield:** 4xp
**Gametime:** 21 PM Spring time, Monday. 
**Session time:** 2-3 hours
**People Encountered:** The Detective - Shane Well
**Recap:**
Setting up a meeting with Detective Well, on the phone were first Zeferet then Elizabeth. They set up the meeting 30 min from “now” at a nearby Hotel, in a suite Elizabeth bought for the night. The coterie arrived first. Once Well showed up they asked him information about the case, and he gave them what he knew about the two victims; Casper Drum and Don Ellard (see victim entries). However, the coterie did manage to both spook the Detective and make a smaller ruckus at the hotel, they did manage to handle it without much trouble (Dominate). Zeferet’s poking around in the Detective’s papers did get noticed by “someone” though (Ceilicans). They did manage to find the victims addresses, and with a little help from the Detective figure out Mr. Ellard might have been involved in cooking (and selling?) ecstasy in his basement. 
With only a few hours left until sunup, the coterie decided to follow their leads the following day; splitting up. 
Cedric and Max went to where the 2nd victim had been found to search for clues, but aside from a little blood, came up empty-handed. Max then went out to hunt causing a bar fight and getting himself drunk amongst other things. Elizabeth went to the firing range to train her shooting (Firearms 2). Zeferet went home to take revenge on Max, by sabotaging his favourite gallery “the Hot Zone” digitally. At last Steffi too, went to a bar causing a ruckus, training his fighting skill. 
Session ended by waking up the next night. Max having extra Rouse checks, landed on **Hunger 4**.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Yield:** ?xp
**Gametime:** 24 PM Spring time, Monday. 
**Session time:** 2-3 hours
**People Encountered:** Cheshire (Ceilican), Dr. Sam
**Recap:**
Morgue group: Max, Elizabeth, Steffi and Interrogation group: Cedric, Zeferet. The interrogation group managed to heavily intimidate their way inside the Ellard household, where the parents told them everything (see victim2 entry). They also  salvaged two hard drives, and some pills. Afterwards, Zeferet went to the Haven and Cedric joined up with the morgue crew.
Max was missing, but they decided to proceed anyway. They managed to get in with Doctor Sam, who left them to investigate. Investigations of the bodies revealed post-mortem damage perhaps designed to look like a crime of passion amongst other thing (see victim entries). They retrieved the victim’s personal belongings, including phones, wallets and a Rolex watch. Near the end they were joined by Cedric. 
In the meantime, Max had had trouble dealing with his hunger.   He satiated himself on an elderly lady, but entered Hunger frenzy, savagely tearing her up (Hunger 0). Through Willpower he steer himself to the sewers, going on a rampage. Regaining his senses, he went to clean up the mess, contacting De Luca. Hiding it so far, and dissoving the body by experimentation, he leaves De Luca to finish up. 
At the haven the coterie is less than pleased with Max, who still smells of sewer. However, the younglings get distracted by another smell of cat. The Ceilicans finally reveal themselves, and, in short, ask them to stay out of their territory/business, and mentions the Detective “needs to be dealt with”. The Ceilican, calling herself Cheshire, dissapears with a smile. 
They get a call from the Detective about a 3rd Victim found in an abandoned building. This time they can be first at the scene. 
Session ends by informing Mr. Matthews and setting up a gallery tour the next night (for coterie& +1's)

actions.message:
Ceilican Size Reference of the 6 forms; Homid (human), Sokto, Crinos (half-and-half), Chatro, Feline (Big cat) and the regular house cat form. This uses a homid-born female Ceilican with a height of a 173 cm as an example. Just like with humans a homid-born male Ceilican will typically be taller (which affects all his forms). 
(Each line is about 1 m, and the dotted lines about 50 cm)
